cs145.kersten.assignment1

Class Checkerboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs145.kersten.assignment1.GameBoard
      • cs145.kersten.assignment1.Checkerboard

  • public class Checkerboard
extends GameBoard
    Checkerboard extends the basic GameBoard to be used specifically for checkers. It provides functionality to display a board as well as calculate the number of jumps available for both red and black players.
    Author:
    Andrew Kersten

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Checkerboard.FileFormat
      Checkerboard.FileFormat is used to determine which type of file we are loading, row major or column major

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Checkerboard()
      Initializes the checkerboard to be CHECKERBOARD_WIDTH wide by CHECKERBOARD_HEIGHT tall

    • Method Detail

      • getCheckersPiece

        public CheckersPiece getCheckersPiece(int row,
                             int col)
        Translates the character stored in the board array into a CheckersPiece
        Parameters:
        row - is the row of the piece to retrieve
        col - is the col of the piece to retrieve
        Returns:
        returns the CheckersPiece equivalent to the character code stored in the board array at row row and column col

      • loadColMajor

        private static void loadColMajor(Checkerboard checkerboard,
                java.util.Scanner scanner)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads column major board files
        Parameters:
        checkerboard - is the checkerboard to store the piece data
        scanner - is the scanner to pull the piece data from
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • loadFromFile

        public static Checkerboard loadFromFile(java.io.File file,
                        Checkerboard.FileFormat format)
        Creates a checkerboard object and sets the pieces on the board as specified by the board file
        Parameters:
        file - is the board file that contains the piece data
        format - is the format of the board file, row major or column major
        Returns:
        returns the checkerboard created from the file
